fieldsOfStudy: Communication with an emphasis in Public Relations
educations.schoolName: The University of Texas at San Antonio

headline: Contracting Officer at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)

defaultPosition.description: Responsible for directing large, complex and/or unusual situations related to acquisition and contract administration; Administer contract pre-award and post-award functions including cost and price analysis and source selection processes; Negotiate Inter-Governmental Service Agreements, service contracts and task orders with detention facilities, sheriff departments and county jails; Acquire a wide variety of commodities including but not limited to: furniture, ammunition and surveillance equipment; Manage a variety of service contracts including: detention management services, health services and guard services; Serve as a business advisor to a wide range of customers; Advise customers of the pertinent program data required to successfully procure professional services and/or equipment; Provide guidance to program offices on matters relating to acquisitions; Develop acquisition strategies in accordance with established policies and procedures.
defaultPosition.title: Contracting Officer

positions.description: Responsible for directing large, complex and/or unusual situations related to acquisition and contract administration; Administer contract pre-award and post-award functions including cost and price analysis and source selection processes; Negotiate Inter-Governmental Service Agreements, service contracts and task orders with detention facilities, sheriff departments and county jails; Acquire a wide variety of commodities including but not limited to: furniture, ammunition and surveillance equipment; Manage a variety of service contracts including: detention management services, health services and guard services; Serve as a business advisor to a wide range of customers; Advise customers of the pertinent program data required to successfully procure professional services and/or equipment; Provide guidance to program offices on matters relating to acquisitions; Develop acquisition strategies in accordance with established policies and procedures.
positions.title: Contracting Officer

positions.description: Plans, negotiates, and administers complex procurement of IT systems & services with specialized, critical requirements. Develops complex pricing arrangements & incentives. Manage contractual aspects of TSA's IT Program, requiring long-range procurement planning. Administer contracts which require day to day negotiation of significant contract changes, monitor numerous special provisions, coordinate extensive subcontracting involvement, and observe rigid time frames. Recommend corrective action plans and procedure improvement for IT acquisitions. Monitor contract performance.  Review, advise, develop, and recommend TSA ITBuy procurement processes, procedures, & policies. Create procurement strategies for TSA IT requirement, implementing the strategy, and executing until contract award.
positions.title: Senior Contract Specialist

positions.description: Perform all pre-award and post award functions related to the procurement of stoker coal, bio-mass wood pellets, and consulting services contracts for United States Military Installations and Civilian Agencies, using the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items, FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, FAR Part 15, Contract by Negotiation, Subpart 16.5, IndefiniteâDelivery Contracts, and FAR SubPart 19.5, Set-Asides for Small Business.
positions.title: Contract Specialist
